label: 10 m Wheeling Forward
instructions: Start at the beginning line, sitting upright.
Hands at ~11 o'clock on the rims, push forward smoothly.
Maintain a straight line and steady pace until you cover 10 meters.
notes: Used for basic propulsion control and endurance.

label: 10 m in 30 seconds (timed)
instructions: Start at the beginning line, sitting upright.
Push to cover 10 meters while time is measured.
Keep steady, controlled pushes so you reach 10 m within 30 s.
notes: Time-based variant of wheeling forward.

label: 5 m Wheeling Backward
instructions: Start at the line facing away from the track.
Hands at ~11 o'clock, push backward steadily for 5 m.
Keep eyes over the shoulder or use short, controlled strokes.
notes: Basic backward mobility control.

label: Forward 90° Turn (left & right)
instructions: Roll forward and practice a smooth 90° turn to the left.
Return to start and repeat to the right.
Use short ARC pushes to pivot while moving forward.
notes: Test both left and right 90-degree turns.

label: Backward 90° Turn (left & right)
instructions: Begin a steady backward roll with short, even strokes (move_backward).
To turn left while reversing: reduce force on the right rim and pull back slightly on the left rim (initiate turn_left). To turn right, reverse the pattern.
Control rate of rotation with short, controlled pushes and brief braking if rotation is too fast (brake).
Once oriented, straighten and roll away or transition to forward movement as needed.
notes: Step-level detail clarifies how to execute the turn while moving backward.

label: 180° Turn In Place (both directions)
instructions: From a stopped position, perform a 180° turn on the spot to the left.
Repeat the 180° turn to the right.
Use opposite-hand strokes to pivot cleanly.

label: Sideways Maneuvering (shuffling)
instructions: Position wheels square and hands at ~11 o'clock on both rims.
Create room by pulling both rims back slightly (small backward stroke).
Turn the chair slightly toward the desired side (15–30°) using a short turn input.
Push forward on the leading rim to translate the chair sideways about 10–20 cm.
Turn back toward neutral (opposite small turn) and repeat pivot → translate → pivot until 0.5 m covered.
Finish by applying a controlled brake to stabilize the chair.
notes: Explicit micro-steps emphasize canonical actions: move_backward, turn_left/turn_right, move_forward, brake.

label: Pass Through Door (both directions)
instructions: Approach the door centered and at a controlled slow speed with hands on rims.
If you must open or hold the door: stop and apply the brake to stabilize before manipulating the handle.
If alignment is needed, back up slightly (move_backward) to create turning room, then perform a small turn (turn_left or turn_right) to align the chair with the doorway.
If a threshold is present, pop the front casters briefly (pop_casters) just before moving through.
Push through the doorway with steady forward control (move_forward) and brake beyond the doorway to stabilize.
notes: Includes stop/brake and optional pop_casters for thresholds; improves retrieval signal for RAG.

label: Reach to 1.5 m Object
instructions: Approach a platform 1.5 m ahead, position chair stable.
Keep wheels locked if necessary; reach to touch the marked point.
Return to neutral position safely.
notes: Tests reach and positioning.

label: Pick Object from Floor
instructions: Position the chair near the object, stabilize wheels if needed.
Lean forward safely and pick the object from the floor.
Return to upright, holding the object securely.

label: Hip Weight Shift (load via hip)
instructions: From sitting upright, perform a controlled weight shift through the hips.
Use small, repeated weight transfers while maintaining balance.
Return to neutral position safely.
notes: No direct mapped skill in repo; uses balance training steps.

label: Transfer to Bench (transfer)
instructions: Approach bench and lock wheels.
Perform a safe transfer using armrests / push-offs.
Return to wheelchair safely after the transfer.
notes: Transfer skill not present in repo; basic safe-transfer steps included.

label: Fold and Unfold Wheelchair
instructions: From a parked chair, demonstrate safe folding steps.
Unfold the chair and lock it into use position.
Show the correct checks (brakes, footrests).
notes: Not present in repo; static task.

label: 100 m Wheeling Forward (endurance)
instructions: Start at the line, hands on rims.
Maintain steady pushes and propell for 100 meters.
Keep posture and breathing steady.
notes: Endurance variant.

label: Obstacle Avoidance (left & right)
instructions: Roll forward and avoid obstacles placed to the left and right.
Use short controlled turns or stops to avoid collisions.
Continue to finish point once clear.

label: 5° Ramp Climb
instructions: Approach ramp centered with momentum.
Lean forward slightly and use strong, short pushes to climb.
Reach the ramp top and stabilize.
notes: Place completion trigger at top of ramp.

label: 5° Ramp Descent
instructions: Start at ramp top, keep hands ready on rims.
Lean back slightly and control descent with small pushes or braking.
Reach flat ground and stabilize.

label: 10° Ramp Climb
instructions: Approach ramp center, push strongly with short arcs.
Lean forward to help push rear wheels up the slope.
Reach ramp top and stop at the trigger.
notes: Higher grade; adjust test tolerance accordingly.

label: 10° Ramp Descent
instructions: Begin at ramp top, keep a controlled posture.
Lean back, use controlled rim contact to slow descent.
Reach bottom and stabilize.

label: 2 m Across 5° Side Slope
instructions: Position on side slope and maintain balance with hands on rims.
Use short, controlled pushes (move_forward) to maintain steady momentum.
Steer slightly toward the uphill side (turn_left if slope drops to right) to counteract downhill drift.
If drift increases, reduce downhill push strength and increase uphill hand force to re-center heading.
Stop and stabilize with the brake after reaching the 2 m target.
notes: Emphasizes small steering corrections and short pushes.

label: 2 m on Soft Surface
instructions: Start on soft surface (e.g., gravel), keep hands ready.
Use lower, more powerful pushes to keep momentum.
Drive 2 meters and stop at the trigger.

label: Cross 15 cm Gap
instructions: Approach the gap with a small controlled momentum using short pushes (move_forward).
Just before the edge, execute a quick pop of the front casters (pop_casters) to lift them over the gap.
Immediately follow with a firm forward push to drive the rear wheels over the 15 cm gap (move_forward).
Once all wheels are clear, apply the brake to stabilize the chair (brake).
notes: Focuses on timing of pop_casters relative to the edge and the follow-through push.

label: Pass 2 cm Threshold
instructions: Approach the small threshold squarely, keep momentum.
Lift front slightly and roll the rear wheels over the threshold.
Stabilize after passing.

label: 5 cm Step Up
instructions: Approach platform, pop front casters and land on platform.
Lean forward and push rear wheels up the 5 cm step.
Stabilize once on top.

label: 5 cm Step Down
instructions: Approach step edge and slowly roll rear wheels down.
Control descent with small pulls on the rims.
Stabilize on lower surface.

label: 15 cm Step Up
instructions: Approach 15 cm curb centered and with momentum.
Pop front casters higher (2–4 in) and land on the curb.
Lean forward and push the rear wheels up onto the curb top.
notes: Mapped to advanced-curb-up; in repo advanced entry mentions spotter for practice — treat as solo test in simulation.

label: 15 cm Step Down
instructions: Approach the curb backward as needed for control.
Control the rear wheels descent to the lower level, keeping balance.
Stabilize after descent.
notes: Mapped to advanced-curb-down-backwards.

label: 30 s Wheelie Hold
instructions: From a safe position, pop into a wheelie and hold for 30 seconds (pop_casters).
Keep balance using small rim adjustments and maintain brake/hand control to prevent tip-back.
Lower wheels safely when time completes.
notes: Advanced skill; recommend spotter during live practice; canonical actions emphasized.

label: Wheelie 180° Turn
instructions: Pop into a stable wheelie (pop_casters) and find the balance point before initiating rotation.
Begin the pivot by using opposite-hand strokes: push forward on the turning direction rim while pulling back on the opposite rim (turn_right or turn_left as needed).
Use small forward/back rim taps to maintain balance while rotating; keep torso steady and eyes on heading.
Make slow, incremental adjustments and pause if balance shifts; if needed, apply brief counter-strokes to correct balance.
When the 180° rotation is complete, carefully lower the front casters and stabilize on all wheels (brake).
notes: Detailed pivot technique for wheelie rotation; emphasize canonical labels for RAG retrieval.

label: Get Up from Floor to Wheelchair
instructions: Demonstrate safe method to return from floor to seated position on wheelchair.
Use correct bracing, roll and pull technique, and ask for assistance if unsafe.
Complete the transfer and stabilize.
notes: This is a transfer scenario derived from clinical guidance; not present as specific repo skill.

label: Stair Climb (multiple helpers required)
instructions: This test requires 3 helpers placed at safe positions.
Coordinate lift to ascend 3–5 steps while maintaining control.
Place completion trigger at top landing.
notes: Repo contains helper-based stair procedures only.

label: Stair Descent (helpers required)
instructions: This test requires 2 helpers to safely descend 3–5 steps.
Helpers support and guide controls; descend in coordinated manner.
Mark completion at bottom landing.
notes: Emergency or multi-helper procedure from repo.
